thread.title: Roos equation to qualify after latest WCQ stumble
thread.title_full: Roos equation to qualify after latest WCQ stumble

title: Roos equation to qualify after latest WCQ stumble
text:
WRAP: Ange’s painful admission after Socceroos draw 
Most crucially is Tuesday’s now ‘must win’ game against the UAE in Sydney. Collect three points and Australia will open up a four point gap on the chasing pack, meaning only a catastrophic will prevent Postecoglou’s men from finishing in the top three. 
Then, beat Saudi Arabia and Thailand in familiar surroundings and that could be enough for Australia to end up in a top two position and qualify automatically for Russia. Mooy's costly miss 
THE UPCOMING CHALLENGES ROOS FACE 
The Socceroos’ vital 2017 just got even more important after the draw in Iran. 
There is now almost no room for errors in World Cup qualification, although Australia still has their own destiny in their hands. 
Get through the UAE on Tuesday, and Australia then have five games in June before playing two more crucial WCQs in August and September. These eight games will determine the fate of the Socceroos. 
- WCQ : Australia v UAE, Tuesday 28 March at 8.00pm (Sydney Football Stadium) 
- WCQ : Australia v Saudi Arabia, Thursday 8 June (TBC) 
- FRIENDLY : Australia v Brazil, Tuesday 13 June at 8.05pm (Melbourne Cricket Ground) 
- CONFEDS : Australia v Germany, Tuesday 20 June at 1.00am (Russia) 
- CONFEDS : Cameroon v Australia, Friday 23 June at 1.00am (Russia) 
- CONFEDS : Chile v Australia, Monday 26 June at 1.00am (Russia) 
- WCQ : Japan v Australia, Thursday 31 August (TBC) 
- WCQ : Australia v Thailand, Tuesday 5 September (TBC) Ref misses handball shout 
WHAT’S THE EQUATION IN THE OTHER GROUP? 
Group A: 
1/ Iran – 14 points, +5 goal difference 
2/ South Korea – 10 points, +1 
3/ Uzbekistan – 9 points, +1 
4/ Syria – 8 points, 0 
5/ China – 5 points, -3 
6/ Qatar – 4 points, -4 
Group B 
1/ Saudi Arabia – 13 points, +7 goal difference 
2/ Japan – 13 points, +5 
3/ Australia – 10 points, +3 
4/ UAE – 9 points, -1 
5/ Iraq – 4 points, -2 
6/ Thailand – 1 point, -12 
CONCACAF GROUP STANDINGS 
Should Australia finish third in their group and progress through the AFC play-off (facing the third placed team in Group A), they will play the fourth placed team in CONCACAF. 
The latest qualifiers for CONCACAF will be played on Saturday AEDT, and so far they have played just two of 10 qualifying games. With that in mind, here is how CONCACAF stands: 
1/ Costa Rica – 6 points, +6 goal difference 
2/ Mexico – 4 points, +1 
3/ Panama – 4 points, +1 
4/ Honduras – 3 points, +1 
5/ Trinidad and Tobago – 0 points, -4 
6/ USA – 0 points, -5
